title: Adobe Edge Reflow
content:
These screenshots are from my early work in Adobe Edge Reflow, a responsive web design tool that was in beta before Adobe XD and Figma existed. Reflow was Adobe's experimental approach to visual responsive designâ€”allowing designers to create fluid layouts with real breakpoints and CSS output. The product was eventually discontinued, and many of its concepts evolved into what became Adobe XD.

I was an early adopter of Reflow during its beta phase, using it to design responsive layouts at a time when responsive web design was still a relatively new concept. These examples represent some of that early exploration into breakpoint-based design and fluid grid systems before the modern design tools we use today were available.

images.caption: Responsive Layout: A responsive web layout created in Adobe Edge Reflow during its beta period. The tool allowed visual manipulation of breakpoints and fluid grid systems.
Breakpoint Design: Designing across multiple breakpoints in Reflow. This was cutting-edge at the time - visually designing responsive behavior before tools like Figma made it commonplace.
Fluid Grid System: Early responsive design work using Reflow's fluid grid capabilities. Adobe discontinued the product, but these concepts carried forward into modern design tools.
